MountOptions.description: The mount options used by DataSync to access the SMB server.

Version.description: The specific SMB version that you want DataSync to use to mount your SMB share.
Version.markdownDescription:
The specific SMB version that you want DataSync to use to mount your SMB share.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Allowed Values: AUTOMATIC | SMB1 | SMB2_0 | SMB2 | SMB3  
Update requires: No interruption

MountOptions.markdownDescription:
The mount options used by DataSync to access the SMB server.

Update requires: No interruption

The key for an AWS resource tag.

Required: Yes  
Type: String  
Minimum Length: 1

The value for an AWS resource tag.

Tag.markdownDescription:

Required: No  
Update requires: No interruption

CmkSecretConfig.description: Specifies configuration information for a DataSync-managed secret, such as a password or set of credentials that DataSync uses to access a specific transfer location, and a customer-managed AWS KMS key.

SecretArn.description: Specifies the ARN for an AWS Secrets Manager secret, managed by DataSync.
SecretArn.markdownDescription:
Specifies the ARN for an AWS Secrets Manager secret, managed by DataSync.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Maximum Length: 2048  
Pattern: ^(arn:(aws|aws-cn|aws-us-gov|aws-iso|aws-iso-b):secretsmanager:[a-z-0-9]+:[0-9]{12}:secret:.*|)$  
Update requires: No interruption

KmsKeyArn.description: Specifies the ARN for the customer-managed AWS KMS key used to encrypt the secret specified for SecretArn. DataSync provides this key to AWS Secrets Manager.
KmsKeyArn.markdownDescription:
Specifies the ARN for the customer-managed AWS KMS key used to encrypt the secret specified for SecretArn. DataSync provides this key to AWS Secrets Manager.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Maximum Length: 2048  
Pattern: ^(arn:(aws|aws-cn|aws-us-gov|aws-iso|aws-iso-b):kms:[a-z-0-9]+:[0-9]{12}:key/.*|)$  
Update requires: No interruption

CmkSecretConfig.markdownDescription:
Specifies configuration information for a DataSync-managed secret, such as a password or set of credentials that DataSync uses to access a specific transfer location, and a customer-managed AWS KMS key.

---

Required: No  
Update requires: No interruption
Read only property: Yes

CustomSecretConfig.description: Specifies configuration information for a customer-managed secret, such as a password or set of credentials that DataSync uses to access a specific transfer location, and an IAM role that DataSync can assume and access the customer-managed secret.

SecretArn.description: Specifies the ARN for a customer created AWS Secrets Manager secret.
SecretArn.markdownDescription:
Specifies the ARN for a customer created AWS Secrets Manager secret.

---

Required: Yes  
Type: String  
Maximum Length: 2048  
Pattern: ^(arn:(aws|aws-cn|aws-us-gov|aws-iso|aws-iso-b):secretsmanager:[a-z-0-9]+:[0-9]{12}:secret:.*|)$  
Update requires: No interruption

SecretAccessRoleArn.description: Specifies the ARN for the AWS Identity and Access Management role that DataSync uses to access the secret specified for SecretArn.
SecretAccessRoleArn.markdownDescription:
Specifies the ARN for the AWS Identity and Access Management role that DataSync uses to access the secret specified for SecretArn.

---

Required: Yes  
Type: String  
Maximum Length: 2048  
Pattern: ^(arn:(aws|aws-cn|aws-us-gov|aws-iso|aws-iso-b):iam::[0-9]{12}:role/.*|)$  
Update requires: No interruption

CustomSecretConfig.markdownDescription:
Specifies configuration information for a customer-managed secret, such as a password or set of credentials that DataSync uses to access a specific transfer location, and an IAM role that DataSync can assume and access the customer-managed secret.

---

Required: No  
Update requires: No interruption

ManagedSecretConfig.description: Specifies configuration information for a DataSync-managed secret, such as a password or set of credentials that DataSync uses to access a specific transfer location. DataSync uses the default AWS-managed KMS key to encrypt this secret in AWS Secrets Manager.

SecretArn.description: Specifies the ARN for an AWS Secrets Manager secret.
SecretArn.markdownDescription:
Specifies the ARN for an AWS Secrets Manager secret.

---

Required: Yes  
Type: String  
Maximum Length: 2048  
Pattern: ^(arn:(aws|aws-cn|aws-us-gov|aws-iso|aws-iso-b):secretsmanager:[a-z-0-9]+:[0-9]{12}:secret:.*|)$  
Update requires: No interruption

ManagedSecretConfig.markdownDescription:
Specifies configuration information for a DataSync-managed secret, such as a password or set of credentials that DataSync uses to access a specific transfer location. DataSync uses the default AWS-managed KMS key to encrypt this secret in AWS Secrets Manager.

Update requires: No interruption

AgentArns.description: The Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of agents to use for a Simple Message Block (SMB) location.

items.markdownDescription:
---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Maximum Length: 128  
Pattern: ^arn:(aws|aws-cn|aws-us-gov|aws-iso|aws-iso-b):datasync:[a-z\-0-9]+:[0-9]{12}:agent/agent-[0-9a-z]{17}$  
Update requires: No interruption

AgentArns.markdownDescription:
The Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of agents to use for a Simple Message Block (SMB) location.

---

Required: Yes  
Type: Array  
Update requires: No interruption

Domain.description: The name of the Windows domain that the SMB server belongs to.
Domain.markdownDescription:
The name of the Windows domain that the SMB server belongs to.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Maximum Length: 253  
Pattern: ^([A-Za-z0-9]+[A-Za-z0-9-.]*)*[A-Za-z0-9-]*[A-Za-z0-9]$  
Update requires: No interruption

Password.description: The password of the user who can mount the share and has the permissions to access files and folders in the SMB share.
Password.markdownDescription:
The password of the user who can mount the share and has the permissions to access files and folders in the SMB share.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Maximum Length: 104  
Pattern: ^.{0,104}$  
Update requires: No interruption

ServerHostname.description: The name of the SMB server. This value is the IP address or Domain Name Service (DNS) name of the SMB server.
ServerHostname.markdownDescription:
The name of the SMB server. This value is the IP address or Domain Name Service (DNS) name of the SMB server.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Maximum Length: 255  
Pattern: ^(([a-zA-Z0-9\-]*[a-zA-Z0-9])\.)*([A-Za-z0-9\-]*[A-Za-z0-9])$  
Update requires: No interruption

Subdirectory.description: The subdirectory in the SMB file system that is used to read data from the SMB source location or write data to the SMB destination
Subdirectory.markdownDescription:
The subdirectory in the SMB file system that is used to read data from the SMB source location or write data to the SMB destination

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Maximum Length: 4096  
Pattern: ^[a-zA-Z0-9_\-\+\./\(\)\$\p{Zs}]+$  
Update requires: No interruption

User.description: The user who can mount the share, has the permissions to access files and folders in the SMB share.
User.markdownDescription:
The user who can mount the share, has the permissions to access files and folders in the SMB share.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Maximum Length: 104  
Pattern: ^[^\x5B\x5D\\/:;|=,+*?]{1,104}$  
Update requires: No interruption

Tags.markdownDescription:
An array of key-value pairs to apply to this resource.

Required: No  
Type: Array  
Update requires: No interruption

LocationArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SMB location that is created.
LocationArn.markdownDescription:
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SMB location that is created.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Maximum Length: 128  
Pattern: ^arn:(aws|aws-cn|aws-us-gov|aws-iso|aws-iso-b):datasync:[a-z\-0-9]+:[0-9]{12}:location/loc-[0-9a-z]{17}$  
Update requires: No interruption
Read only property: Yes

LocationUri.description: The URL of the SMB location that was described.
LocationUri.markdownDescription:
The URL of the SMB location that was described.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Maximum Length: 4356  
Pattern: ^(efs|nfs|s3|smb|fsxw)://[a-zA-Z0-9./\-]+$  
Update requires: No interruption
Read only property: Yes

AuthenticationType.description: The authentication mode used to determine identity of user.
AuthenticationType.markdownDescription:
The authentication mode used to determine identity of user.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Allowed Values: NTLM | KERBEROS  
Update requires: No interruption

DnsIpAddresses.description: Specifies the IPv4 addresses for the DNS servers that your SMB file server belongs to. This parameter applies only if AuthenticationType is set to KERBEROS. If you have multiple domains in your environment, configuring this parameter makes sure that DataSync connects to the right SMB file server.

items.markdownDescription:
---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Minimum Length: 7  
Maximum Length: 15  
Pattern: \A(25[0-5]|2[0-4]\d|[0-1]?\d?\d)(\.(25[0-5]|2[0-4]\d|[0-1]?\d?\d)){3}\z  
Update requires: No interruption

DnsIpAddresses.markdownDescription:
Specifies the IPv4 addresses for the DNS servers that your SMB file server belongs to. This parameter applies only if AuthenticationType is set to KERBEROS. If you have multiple domains in your environment, configuring this parameter makes sure that DataSync connects to the right SMB file server.

---

Required: No  
Type: Array  
Update requires: No interruption

KerberosPrincipal.description: Specifies a service principal name (SPN), which is an identity in your Kerberos realm that has permission to access the files, folders, and file metadata in your SMB file server. SPNs are case sensitive and must include a prepended cifs/. For example, an SPN might look like cifs/kerberosuser@EXAMPLE.COM. Your task execution will fail if the SPN that you provide for this parameter doesn't match exactly what's in your keytab or krb5.conf files.
KerberosPrincipal.markdownDescription:
Specifies a service principal name (SPN), which is an identity in your Kerberos realm that has permission to access the files, folders, and file metadata in your SMB file server. SPNs are case sensitive and must include a prepended cifs/. For example, an SPN might look like cifs/kerberosuser@EXAMPLE.COM. Your task execution will fail if the SPN that you provide for this parameter doesn't match exactly what's in your keytab or krb5.conf files.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Minimum Length: 1  
Maximum Length: 256  
Pattern: ^.+$  
Update requires: No interruption

KerberosKeytab.description: The Base64 string representation of the Keytab file. Specifies your Kerberos key table (keytab) file, which includes mappings between your service principal name (SPN) and encryption keys. To avoid task execution errors, make sure that the SPN in the keytab file matches exactly what you specify for KerberosPrincipal and in your krb5.conf file.
KerberosKeytab.markdownDescription:
The Base64 string representation of the Keytab file. Specifies your Kerberos key table (keytab) file, which includes mappings between your service principal name (SPN) and encryption keys. To avoid task execution errors, make sure that the SPN in the keytab file matches exactly what you specify for KerberosPrincipal and in your krb5.conf file.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Maximum Length: 87384  
Update requires: No interruption

KerberosKrb5Conf.description: The string representation of the Krb5Conf file, or the presigned URL to access the Krb5.conf file within an S3 bucket. Specifies a Kerberos configuration file (krb5.conf) that defines your Kerberos realm configuration. To avoid task execution errors, make sure that the service principal name (SPN) in the krb5.conf file matches exactly what you specify for KerberosPrincipal and in your keytab file.
KerberosKrb5Conf.markdownDescription:
The string representation of the Krb5Conf file, or the presigned URL to access the Krb5.conf file within an S3 bucket. Specifies a Kerberos configuration file (krb5.conf) that defines your Kerberos realm configuration. To avoid task execution errors, make sure that the service principal name (SPN) in the krb5.conf file matches exactly what you specify for KerberosPrincipal and in your keytab file.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Maximum Length: 174764  
Update requires: No interruption
